intro: Cracca pachypoda, commonly known as the broad-leaf cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cracca pachypoda is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in a garden setting.
